summary: Most requested marketing site and application/payment flow appear implemented: Home/Apply/FAQs navigation, prestigious theme, FAQ accordion, static generated brand images usage, Stripe checkout with success/failure pages, and backend application persistence with an admin-oriented listing method. However, the diff introduces explicit admin/access-control and user-profile features that were not requested (and were called out as non-goals). Some backend acceptance criteria (newest-first ordering in the admin list) cannot be fully verified due to backend truncation.

missing_requirements.requirement: Backend admin query lists submitted applications (most recent first), including key fields and payment status.
missing_requirements.reason: A getAllApplications method exists but the diff is truncated before showing that results are actually sorted newest-first and that all required fields are included in the returned list. Only a compare function is shown; the actual sorting/ordering logic is not visible.

hallucinated_features.description: Admin/access-control system with admin-only Stripe configuration and secret-based initialization from a URL parameter.
hallucinated_features.reason: The BuildRequest explicitly lists admin authentication/role management as a non-goal, but the diff adds permissions, admin checks, and an initialization flow using a secret token.

hallucinated_features.description: User profile management endpoints (get/save caller profile, view profile).
hallucinated_features.reason: User profiles are not requested by any requirement; the request focuses on marketing pages, application submission, payment, FAQs, and an admin listing query.
